rules: Rule1: If MedTechCorp develops the Smart Hospital Bed, then MedTechCorp receives government grant funding
Rule2: MedTechCorp develops the Smart Hospital Bed or MedTechCorp develops the AI Diagnostic System
Rule3: If MedTechCorp hires a clinical research director, then the Smart Hospital Bed receives FDA approval or the AI Diagnostic System receives FDA approval
Rule4: MedTechCorp faces a lawsuit or if MedTechCorp hires a regulatory expert, then the Smart Hospital Bed receives FDA approval or the AI Diagnostic System receives FDA approval
Rule5: If MedTechCorp maintains HIPAA compliance, then MedTechCorp implements encryption for patient data
Rule6: If MedTechCorp implements encryption for patient data, then MedTechCorp does not face a lawsuit
Rule7: If MedTechCorp merges with Pharma Giant, then MedTechCorp loses autonomy
Rule8: MedTechCorp merges with Pharma Giant or MedTechCorp achieves profitability
Rule9: MedTechCorp accepts an acquisition offer or if the board votes against the merger, then if MedTechCorp merges with Pharma Giant, then MedTechCorp does not lose autonomy
Rule10: If MedTechCorp secures venture funding, then MedTechCorp does not accept an acquisition offer
Rule11: If MedTechCorp issues new shares, then MedTechCorp does not accept an acquisition offer
Rule12: If MedTechCorp develops the AI Diagnostic System, then MedTechCorp achieves profitability
Rule13: If MedTechCorp meets investors at the tech conference, then MedTechCorp secures venture funding
Rule14: MedTechCorp meets investors at the tech conference or MedTechCorp presents its business plan to investors
Rule15: If MedTechCorp presents its business plan to investors, then MedTechCorp issues new shares
Rule16: If the FDA investigates adverse events related to the Smart Hospital Bed, then the FDA conducts an inspection of the manufacturing facility
Rule17: If the FDA issues a warning letter to MedTechCorp, then MedTechCorp recalls the Smart Hospital Bed product

Rule18: If the quality team detects a malfunction in the Smart Hospital Bed, then if the FDA investigates adverse events related to the Smart Hospital Bed, then the FDA issues a warning letter to MedTechCorp
Rule19: The quality team detects a malfunction in the Smart Hospital Bed or hospital staff reports an incident with the Smart Hospital Bed

Rule20: If hospital staff reports an incident with the Smart Hospital Bed, then if the FDA investigates adverse events related to the Smart Hospital Bed, then the FDA issues a warning letter to MedTechCorp
Rule21: If the FDA conducts an inspection of the manufacturing facility, then the FDA reviews clinical documentation
Rule22: If MedTechCorp resolves quality problems, then if the FDA reviews clinical documentation, then the FDA issues a warning letter to MedTechCorp

Rule23: MedTechCorp acquires a startup company or if MedTechCorp receiving government grant funding does not lead to MedTechCorp achieving profitability, then MedTechCorp files a patent for the medical algorithm
Rule24: If the Smart Hospital Bed receives FDA approval, then MedTechCorp conducts clinical trials for the Smart Hospital Bed
Rule25: If the AI Diagnostic System receives FDA approval, then MedTechCorp achieves profitability
Rule26: MedTechCorp hires a regulatory expert or MedTechCorp hires a clinical research director
Rule27: If MedTechCorp does not resolve quality problems, then MedTechCorp declares bankruptcy
Rule28: If MedTechCorp does not resolve quality problems, then MedTechCorp does not declare bankruptcy
Rule29: If MedTechCorp does not achieve profitability, then the FDA investigates adverse events related to the Smart Hospital Bed
facts: Fact2: The board votes against the merger
Fact3: MedTechCorp does not recall the Smart Hospital Bed product
Fact4: MedTechCorp does not file a patent for the medical algorithm
Fact5: MedTechCorp does not acquire a startup company
Fact6: MedTechCorp does not conduct clinical trials for the Smart Hospital Bed
